intro: Cheiridopsis turbinata, commonly known as the Turban Flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Cheiridopsis turbinata is drought-tolerant and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid landscapes.
